author: Imperial13
title: great.
review: I remember having this set and playing with it a lot! it shoots the disk reletivly far, although it can get lost very fast. If you collect all of them you can make them into a big guy. not worth more than 2.00 dollars

author: Gus_263
title: Swimmer ga-matoran
review: A female matoran, likes very to the others and includes a noble huna mask, same of turaga vakama. The head is different than the another heads. only in one arm the disk can be launched, and in it, have a image of gali's mask. The legs were used later in the bohrok-va.

author: deadtree103
title: My first BIONICLE set.
review:
This is probably the BEST promotion Mcdonald's has ever done and ever will do.Alas,i find myself with no part's left of her.A shame i know.But on to the pro's and con's!


Pro's!:)

*There is no con's!

author: Pepper
title: cute
review:
I got this set at a garage sale last year minus one foot. Well, onto the pros. and cons.

Pros.
cute
nice disk
nice mask
throws the disk

Cons.
too small
should have a different (sp?) mask

Overall, good set for Bionicle collectors.

author: mvila09
title: Great Matoran!
review: Hey all,i just want to admit that this was my first Bionicle set.Sadly all that i have left of Maku is the head,mask,and disc.Anyways heres the Pros and Cons.Pros Good bionicle set.Happy meal,Hey its free!,Mask is very cool looking,Did i mention the disc launching arm?!Cons none!*****5 stars.

author: krysto2002
title: McDonalds finally makes something worthwhile
review:
So McDonalds has created a decent Happy Meal (just around the time I ate them!) and with it, a free LEGO set. Though this does not have the bricks that the previous LEGO/McDonalds kits had, it does however have Bionicle masks. The torso is really cool and can serve many creative purposes. The head is really blocky, but has been used often since its creation. The throwing arm, though bsed on throwbots technology, is not as good as the powerful throwbot arms, or the Vahki pincers to come.

This is one of the lesser Matoran, since the mask and disk differ, and the color scheme is kind of "enh", so it isn't really all that great (but you didn't expect McDonalds to actually include a transparent part did you? It would be much cheaper to mass produce if the mask and body were the same color).

author: Kalhiki
title: adorable!
review:
All of these Matoran are adorable. Maku (later on Macku but not in this set) is a great set. But, as with all of these guy, they aren't very posable. But they're from McDonalds Happy Meals. Maku has the disk flingy army thingy and another arm that has a "claw". She's very short, but once again it's from a Happy Meal. This is also the only set were you can get a Blue Huna so that's a bonus. 
Overall, a good set. You dont have o get her, but it's a good addition to the collection, or for parts. It's also a nice piece for the shelf display, or a paperweight.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Matoran) - Maku Review
review:
This is a great little figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

This set doesn't have an instruction but you don't really need it: It's so easy that you can build it from the picture.

Parts

This set may doesn't have many pieces but they're still very nice to have - even for future MOC's (My Own Creations) and/or brickfilms. There's also a printed disc included in this set.

The build

The build vas very nice and easy and you also don't have to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/1390-1.jpg[/img]


The legs can be moved and the arms can be adjusted a little bit as well. One arm allows you to shoot the discs. Even if this set doesn't have many play features I think it's still good to have, because this figure will go up in value in a few years.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Alex13542
title: My First Bionicle, Maku
review:
This was my first bionicle and lego, which grew too be a colection of 131 sets!
Maku is very cool mainly because of his bendable arms and cool mask. His mask comes in blue red and silver/black but I like this the best. His main body is cool and he is basicly an assortmant of super rare peices and is a must have for any peice conscious bionicle fan!

pros: 
        cool arms
        awsome mask
        wicked body
        tricked out feet

cons: 
         Realy? Is this necessary? I don't just think so! I know so!

A good set for any peice conscious bionicle fan!

author: The_Dumb_One
title: Don't point your arm at me!
review:
The main good things about this set are the rare mask and the disk arm. The build is virtually inexistant and there are, like, 5 or 6 parts, so you can't do much with that.

I have also purchased onepu and comparing the two, I feel like I'm comparing a hambuger and a Big Mac. They have a few differences, but they're essencially the same.

author: Cligra
title: Very nice, for what it is.
review: This little promo McToran set includes Maku, a Ga-Koro villager. The design is nice, and the parts are practically exclusive, at least in the colours seen here. The "gimmick" of this villager (and all of the McToran) is that you can pull back their arms and throw a small disc. The disc launches surprisingly far, and looks quite nice. While I wouldn't spend much monet on this set (I got it as a gift), I would definitely recommend it if you find it for under three or four dollars, or if you are a huge BIONICLE fan.

author: 123MrBrick
title: The Odd McToran Out.
review:
I recently got 5 of the McToran (the six McDonalds Bionicle figures) from ebay and I am very happy with them. I really like Maku because she is different from the rest of the group.

Box/Instructions

I got these figures loose so I can't really say anything here. Look at Brickset's picture if you want to see the polybag.

Parts

Maku shares all of her parts, with the exception of the mask, with her fellow McToran. Maku has the parts in unique colors, though. After those similarities, things start to get weird. Unlike the rest of the McToran, who have colors different from their respective Toa, Maku has the standard shades of blue. While her Bamboo Disk features the Kanohi Kaukau, she wears a powerless Kanohi Huna.

The build

Building this set takes maybe 30 seconds. There are only 8 parts in the set, and it is extremely simple to peg it all together.

The completed model

I really like the finished product. While it is not the most realistic design, the figure still looks cool. She has several features: her right arm will throw the included Bamboo Disk when pulled back; her other arm will "punch" when pulled back, and she can store her Bamboo Disk on her back. I am kind of worried that the arms will break, but so far nothing has happened. I  have not been able to knock her mask off with a punch or Disk throw, which is kind of disappointing.

Overall opinion

This set will really only appeal to Bionicle fans. Unless you really want to get the whole set of them, I think getting one McToran will bring you the same amount of fun as getting all of them. I mainly got these for the Kanohi masks.

author: Matroxide
title: Turaga Nokama's Right Hand
review: I can remember like it was just a few days ago, it was 2001 and my family were going to McDonalds for dinner. I had Chicken Nuggets and I was excited to see a little blue figure in a bag. Macku was my first Bionicle set ever and I played with her for hours! I flung the that disk she came with for the rest of the day fighting with my brother's Hewkii. now my Bionicle collection had grown just about to every bionicle set ever with only a few missing. as I say for all my 2001 matoran reviews, you can combine Macku with Kongu and Matoro to make a Matoran version of Wairuha, or with all of them to make the Matoran Nui in the comic every Matoran came with! Macku came with her bright blue Kanohi Huna, the Mask of Concealment, a bamboo disk, made of plastic, and a realy cute appearence!

author: Gameaucracy
title: Maku, damn near killed 'em, huehuehuehue
review:
Oh yeah baby, the McDonalds sets. These were amazing when I was a kid. A LEGO set AND heart-attack inducing chunks of question-mark chicken? Where do I sign? Oh right I was a kid I didn't have to sign anything! Just had to pester my parents enough to take me there. Oh memories of that ball-pit, I can still smell the discarded diapers (psychiatrist says I'm making great progress).

The set is just a bare-bones Bionicle set, like 3 parts with a disk that you can shoot at your brother when he tries to steal one of your fries. Yeah yeah LEGO instructions, I see your "don't hit anyone in the face" warning. This was back in the wild west days of lawsuits, don't need no rules to ruin my good time.

So instead of describing these sets, I'm just going to copy paste the last paragraphs and instead describe the amazing sodium and trans-fats meal I had.

For this set I had a hamburger Happy Meal. At least I think it was a hamburger, with how thin the patty was they could have just colored a piece of writing paper with those brown smelly markers they used to have in school (ah, cleverly disguised things to get high on) and I wouldn't have known the distance. And I'm pretty sure the onion was just chunks of plastic that broke off the cup lids. Overall pretty good meal.

 

Score: 1 smelly marker out of 4 hours or tripping balls man. I mean, whoa, for real, my hands are so warm!
